io.github.gotonode.compress.io

Class BinaryWriteTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.gotonode.compress.io.BinaryWriteTool

  • public class BinaryWriteTool
extends java.lang.Object
    This tool is used to write in binary data. Used by both Huffman and LZW.

    Helper methods have been created to write in the specified amount of data at once (1 bit, 32 bits, 1 byte etc).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BinaryWriteTool(java.io.File file)
      Instantiates this object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void flushAndClose()
      Clears the buffer (writes the bytes into the stream), flushes the stream into the output file (actual disk I/O operation) and closes the streams.
      void write(int value)
      Writes into the stream.
      void writeCodeword(int value)
      Writes a codeword to the stream.
      void writeInt(int value)
      Writes an integer value into the stream.
      void writeOneBit()
      Writes a 1 (true boolean) into the stream.
      void writeString(java.lang.String value)
      Writes a String into the stream.
      void writeZeroBit()
      Writes a 0 (false boolean) into the stream.

      • BinaryWriteTool

        public BinaryWriteTool(java.io.File file)
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Instantiates this object.
        Parameters:
        file - The file we'll be writing to.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the file isn't found.

    • Method Detail

      • writeInt

        public void writeInt(int value)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an integer value into the stream. Bitwise operations to make it exactly 32 bits long, in case it's shorter.
        Parameters:
        value - The 32-bit integer to write in.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we can't write to the stream.

      • writeZeroBit

        public void writeZeroBit()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a 0 (false boolean) into the stream. This is buffered, and may not be written when this method is invoked. We only write 8 bits (a byte) at a time. Flushing is done at the end.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we can't write to the stream.

      • writeOneBit

        public void writeOneBit()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a 1 (true boolean) into the stream. This is buffered, and may not be written when this method is invoked. We only write 8 bits (a byte) at a time. Flushing is done at the end.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we can't write to the stream.

      • write

        public void write(int value)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes into the stream.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be written.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we can't write to the stream.

      • writeCodeword

        public void writeCodeword(int value)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a codeword to the stream.
        Parameters:
        value - The codeword to write.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we can't write to the stream.

      • flushAndClose

        public void flushAndClose()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Clears the buffer (writes the bytes into the stream), flushes the stream into the output file (actual disk I/O operation) and closes the streams.

        After this method has been called, this class should not be reused.

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we can't write to the stream or to the file.

      • writeString

        public void writeString(java.lang.String value)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a String into the stream. It is processed one character at a time, so this is a convenience function.
        Parameters:
        value - The String value to be written to the stream.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If we can't write to the stream or to the file.
